results.title: The Confident learner: self-esteem in children (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Thomas W. Gregroy and Lawren Productions
results.brief_description: Shows how the teacher can create conditions whereby a child can learn to build a self image of competence, a willingness to take risks, an ability to deal with mistakes, and self motivation.

results.title: The Closet = Le Placard [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Francis Veber, Alain Poire, TF1 Films productions, EFVE, Canal+ and Gaumont-British Instructional
results.brief_description: The Closet is a farcical French comedy from writer/director Francis Veber (The Dinner game, Les Fugitifs, The Birdcage). Francois Pignon (Daniel Auteuil) is an accountant in a rubber factory, where he is regarded as boring, insignificant, disposable and ‘unmanly’. Pignon, estranged from his ex-wife and teenage son, is about to be fired, an event that he regards as catastrophic. His response to his impending unemployment is attempted suicide until his new neighbour (Michel Aumont) talks him out of that plan and into another - if Pignon pretends he is gay the company will not fire him for fear of seeming homophobic. The effects on Pignon’s life, of his decision to come out of the closet, are enormous and ricochet into the lives of family and colleagues. “The Closet” explores notions of homophobia, machismo, discrimination, work place relationships and sexuality in a comedic manner. Stars some of France’s finest actors - Daniel Auteuil, Gerard Depardieu, Michele Laroque, Thierry Lhermitte and Jean Rochefort. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: The Confessional = Le Confessionnal
results.creator_credit: Robert Robert Lepage, Philippe Carcassonne, David Puttnam, Denise Robert, Cinea, Enigma Films and Cinemaginaire
results.brief_description: Past, present and the world of cinema merge in this unique and visually innovate thriller. Quebec, 1952, and the church is abuzz as master director Alfred Hitchcock (played by Ron Burrage) is in town to film “I Confess”. An equally gripping story is going on in the background - the elements echoing that of the plot, as 16 year old church worker, Rachel (Suzanne Clement), is with child to an unknown father, only a young priest knows the truth. Quebec, 1989 and Pierre (Lothaire Bluteau) returns home to attend the funeral of his father. During his stay Pierre vows to solve the mystery of the parentage of his half brother, Marc (Patrick Goyette)- Rachel’s son, a discontented rent boy and father of a young child. Pierre’s mission is not an easy one, as the secrets of the past and heredity cloud the situation and find resonance in the future. Like the plot of Hitchcock’s film, only one man holds the key to past and present that was disclosed to him in the confines of the confessional. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: The Concert for Bangla Desh
results.creator_credit: Saul Swimmer, Allen Klein, George Harrison, Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation and Apple
results.brief_description: Filmed live performance of a special benefit concert for the starving refugees of Bangla Desh in New York’s Madison Square Gardens in 1971. A collaborative effort by George Harrison and Ravi Shankar, this amazing concert assembled together some of the greats in the British and American rock music industry including Eric Clapton, Bob Dylan, Billy Preston, Leon Russell, Ringo Starr, Ali Akbar Khan, Klaus Voorman, Badfinger. The first half of the concert features an Indian music presentation led by Ravi Shankar followed by George Harrison and his guest performers in the second half. The concert raised $US250,000 with further monies raised through record sales. Songs include “My sweet Lord “, “It don’t come easy”, “Here comes the sun”, “Just like a woman”, “A Hard rain’s gonna fall”. Also includes documentary footage of Bangla Desh.

results.title: The Climates of North America
results.creator_credit: Joseph Koenig, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The film shows what climate is and how it shapes the vegetation and the life of the inhabitants of North America’s climatic regions - from the North Pole to the Tropic of Cancer.

results.title: The Billiard room
results.creator_credit: Peter Weir, Joe Scully, Film Australia and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Adults Learning”.
Designed to promote group discussion on the problems of the adult learning process in management-staff relations through a discussion between a potential university dropout, his friend and an onlooker. It suggests that not all learning occurs in the classroom. This film should not be screened by itself as a documentary. It does not provide direct information on the process of adult learning. It is a teaching aid which provides a basis for discussion.

results.title: The Field day
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Adults Learning”.
A teaching aid to promote group discussion on the problems of the adult learning process in the management-staff relations. Shows a gathering at a rural agricultural field day. The film seems to be pointing out that resistance to new ideas is hard to overcome.

results.title: The Computer wore tennis shoes
results.creator_credit: Robert Butler, Bill Anderson and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: Featuring a very young Kurt Russell as Dexter, student leader at Medfield College who is transformed into a human being with a hard drive memory when the computer he is repairing is unexpectedly struck by a bolt of lightning. This act of nature presents all manner of problems for Dexter as his brain begins to discover certain information about the somewhat suspect activities of the College’s rich benefactor A.J. Arno (Cesar Romero) who donated the computer in the first place. The story bounces along from adventure to adventure, revealing secrets and plans, a kidnapping and a rescue. Cast includes Joe Flynn, William Schallert, Alan Hewitt.
